body:
@schneems - there's actually a git setting to control the behavior: `help.autocorrect`. It can either turn off autocorrect (if 0), configure the time delay (if >= 1), or automatically run the correction (if < 0). It's clearly more of a personal preference, at least for Git users.

Some other gotchas with the patch:

- the join that rebuilds the command line (line 117) will fall over if quoted arguments are used, since they show up in ARGV with the quotes stripped. 

- as noted above, `bundle exec` is not always the correct way to run commands; some people will be running rails as `bin/rails`, etc.
